intro: Raoulia hookeri var. apice-nigra, commonly known as the black-tipped raoulia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and distinctive black-tipped flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. The species is relatively rare and is often found in specific ecological niches within its native habitat.
